id: Raheem Sterling not scared anymore, says Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola – video
paragraph:
Pep Guardiola has warned rivals there is more to come from Raheem Sterling after the winger inspired Manchester City to a 6-1 rout of Southampton which sent them back to the top of the Premier League. Sterling scored twice, taking him to 50 City goals, and added two assists to cap off a week in which he verbally agreed a new five-year deal with the reigning champions. When asked what had changed with the 23-year-old to spark his 'incredible form', Guardiola replied: 'His head ... the first season, he was scared, he was looking, "who is the guy I am going to pass the ball to?"' His coach continued: 'I have the feeling he is now enjoying scoring goals and making assists. He is becoming a winning player.'Source: SNTV
